uk.co.saiman.experiment.spectrum

Interface ByteFormat<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RegularSampledContinuousFunctionByteFormat, RegularSampledDomainByteFormat

    public interface ByteFormat<T>
    A binary data format for loading and saving to and from a certain object type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getPathExtension() 
      default T load(Path location) 
      default T load(Path location, String name) 
      T load(ReadableByteChannel inputChannel)
      Load an object from a readable byte channel.
      default void save(Path location, String name, T data) 
      default void save(Path location, T data) 
      void save(WritableByteChannel outputChannel, T data)
      Save an object to a writable byte channel.

    • Method Detail

      • getPathExtension

        String getPathExtension()
        Returns:
        the default path extension for files of this format

      • load

        T load(ReadableByteChannel inputChannel)
throws IOException
        Load an object from a readable byte channel.

        The calling context should take care of opening and cleaning up resources. The channel is assumed to be already open upon invocation, and should not be closed by any implementing method.

        Parameters:
        inputChannel - the input byte source
        Returns:
        the object represented by the bytes
        Throws:
        IOException - it's an IO operation after all...

      • load

        default T load(Path location)
        throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        for the given file path

      • load

        default T load(Path location,
               String name)
        throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        for the given path and file name, using the {@link #getPathExtension() default extension}

      • save

        void save(WritableByteChannel outputChannel,
          T data)
   throws IOException
        Save an object to a writable byte channel.

        The calling context should take care of opening and cleaning up resources. The channel is assumed to be already open upon invocation, and should not be closed by any implementing method.

        Parameters:
        outputChannel - the output byte sink
        data - the object represented by the bytes
        Throws:
        IOException - it's an IO operation after all...

                  T data)
           throws IOException
